page.title: 06 HOUSING
page.content: All the buildings in this area are stone-built, the only exception being the front of Green Farm, which is brick. The older buildings are sandstone, the new ones reconstituted stone. Half the houses in the village are over one hundred years old and a quarter of them are more than two hundred years old. Of the other half, the majority of them have been built since the second world war. Many of the older houses have been modernised in recent years also. Some of the new dwellings are bungalows, but there are still many more houses than bungalows. Houses are quite expensive to buy in this village. They might cost between forty thousand and one hundred thousand pounds at the moment, depending upon size and position.
